seo.title: Carpet and Duct Cleaning
seo.description: Improve your home with carpet, air duct, upholstery, and tile & grout cleaning.

props.heading: Carpet and Duct Cleaning
props.description: Improve your home with carpet, air duct, upholstery, and tile & grout cleaning.

props.title: Why clean your home with Sears Home Services?

children.value: A clean home is a refreshing place to be. But clean isn’t just about looks. A clean home is also a healthier place to live, because it reduces you and your family’s exposure to allergens and germs. Let Sears Home Services help you keep your home cleaner and healthier with our cleaning services. We can brighten your dingy carpet and upholstery, clean gross grout and tiles, get the dust out of your air ducts, remove lint from your dryer’s exhaust and help you choose the right air purifier to improve your home’s air.

props.title: Let us do the hard work

items.quote: He was very professional. Courteous and respectful of our environment.
items.author: Karen K, Santa Rosa Valley, CA
Jennifer R, Desert Hot Springs, CA
Karen K, Santa Rosa Valley, CA

items.title: Snowblower repair
items.quote: The repairman was excellent and his technical knowledge was superb. He took his time to adjust all the components. He also performed all the maintenance tasks. The snowblower is working like it was brand new. He saved me a lot of money because I was thinking about purchasing a new one
items.author: George B, Englishtown, NJ

items.title: Service experience
items.quote: He was very pleasant and easy to work with and patiently explained the process and what items were were require required thank you
items.author: Diane B, Mount Airy, MD

items.title: Dryer maintenance
items.quote: Through and polite…arrived at the said time, did a great job…
items.author: Robert D, Glen Mills, PA

items.title: Excellent service!
items.quote: Rudy explained and resolved the problem with the washer and also gave very helpful advice on the maintenance. Very professional while also being personable.
items.author: Cecilia L, Los Angeles, CA

items.title: Excellent Service
items.quote: Anthony was efficient and thorough and explained things very well.
items.author: Elinor W, Berkeley, CA

items.title: Heater Repair
items.quote: Our technician came who serviced our other heater before. He was knowledgeable and ordered the part right away by the time I put the claim in it was repaired within a week. Excellent service.
items.author: Cletis R, Carson, CA

items.title: Refrigerator
items.quote: He was very helpful and knowledgeable. Great job! I would definitely want him to come to fix my appliances
items.author: Lourdes A, Austin, TX

items.title: GREAT service
items.quote: Let me know when they were coming. On time. Answered questions. Did a thorough job.
items.author: Elizabeth M, Gallatin, TN

items.title: Great Service
items.quote: Brian did a great job explaining what he did with the dishwasher and gave me suggestions to keep it clean! He also put up with my crazy dog Chance!
items.author: Liz H, Columbus, OH

resources.title: How to Clean the Filter on a Whirlpool Dishwasher: A Step-by-Step Guide
resources.description: Want to know how to clean the filter on a Whirlpool dishwasher? Our step-by-step instructions will help you keep your dishwasher running smoothly in 2026 and beyond.

resources.title: How HVAC Maintenance Saves Energy
resources.description: Routine HVAC system maintenance isn’t just about comfort—it’s about saving energy and money. Learn how regular tune-ups reduce energy waste, improve efficiency, and keep your system lasting longer.

resources.title: Refrigerator Maintenance Tips You Can Trust
resources.description: Don't let a broken refrigerator spoil your day. Keep it running smoothly with regular refrigerator maintenance from Sears Home Services.

resources.title: HVAC Tips to Maintain the Best Humidity Levels
resources.description: Discover how to maintain the best humidity levels in your house with these helpful HVAC tips.

terms.term: What is the drum of the washing machine?
terms.definition: The drum is the core part of the washer that holds your laundry and enables the cleaning process through rotation, agitation, and rinsing.

The 608 Certification, mandated by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), is required for HVAC technicians to legally handle refrigerants. It ensures technicians understand refrigerant types, environmental impact, and proper handling techniques.

A compressor is a mechanical device that increases the pressure of a gas by reducing its volume, essential in various systems including refrigerators, air conditioners, and HVAC units for cooling and refrigeration processes.
A condenser is a component of HVAC and refrigeration systems, responsible for releasing absorbed heat from the refrigerant into the outside air or a water line, thus facilitating the cooling process.

symptoms.description: When your Payne central air conditioner won’t turn on or isn’t cooling, check for power problems, a failed capacitor, or a clogged condensate drain. This guide covers quick, safe troubleshooting steps and explains when to call Sears Home Services for expert central AC repair.
